Text:
You are right twice (what you mentioned about Sun Tzu and Prince) and wrong once - Machiavelli DID write Art of war, you can check this fact even in the easiest place to do it called Wikipedia:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Art_of_War_%28Machiavelli%29

Conclusion: check the sources before claiming something stupid!
dont matter who wrote what, you cant listen to this crap anyways

So do not download and get lost. This "crap@ for you is treasure for other people.

By the way - this place is NOT your fucking property so take your miserable complaints somewhere else (I suggest publish them on the wall of your own WC)

Another agent provocateur ???

And thank you stryde2101 for nice comment. As you probably see I try to add knowledge to this place, and keep it parasite free. Therefore I suggest for them books of Victor Ostrovski - look at DragonKP logo.

Sun Tzu was active in the late-sixth century BC and wrote "The Art of War". Machiavelli's "Art of War" may have been a stand-alone writing done with no knowledge of the prior or it may have been adapted by Machiavelli for his modern times.
